summary:
I am a trained applied mathematician now working as an algorithm engineer and software developer.  
I am currently working as  Rust software engineer at Heliax helping to develop the ledger behind the Anoma network.

Previously I worked as  a researcher and afterward worked as a data scientist and later as an algorithm engineer. 

 I have lead the algorithms chapter at start-up company from from pre - product launch to scale-up phase and taken ownership of two large existing codebases and overseen their maintenance and development throughout this period.

I have also contributed to open source projects and I am always excited about new technology and a chance to learn something new and expand my skill set. 

During my studies I focused on (among other things)
 * Symbolic computation
 * Complexity theory
 * Algorithm design
 * Quantum computing
 * Cryptography
 * Computational geometry

Since working as software developer, I have acquired the following skills:
 * Algorithm analysis, maintainance, and development (performance analysis, optimization in both speed and memory, to thread safety, memory leaks)
 * Owner and maintainer of multiple large code bases (both pre-existing that I took on)
 * Worked in a polyglot environment (day to day work in Python, C++, and Rust)
 * Databases: SQL, Postgres
 * GIS, especially in regards to traffic map and public transportation data,
 * CI/CD tooling, including Travis and Jenkins
 * Docker and microservice architectures
 * Protobuf, Avro, Kafka, ZeroMQ
 * REST APIs
 * Data science and machine learning
